Chris Martin and Dakota Johnson Seek Lord Shiva’s Blessings Ahead of Coldplay Concert in Mumbai

Date: January 18, 2025 Source: Times of India

In anticipation of Coldplay’s performances in India, Chris Martin and Dakota Johnson visited the Shri Babulnath Temple in Mumbai to seek blessings from Lord Shiva, garnering admiration from fans worldwide.

  • Chris wore a pastel blue kurta and engaged with the local traditions.
  • Dakota donned a modest suit, showing respect for Indian customs.
  • Videos of Dakota whispering a wish to Nandi, Lord Shiva’s bull, went viral.
  • Fans showed overwhelming support for the couple on social media.
  • Coldplay is scheduled to perform three shows in Navi Mumbai and one in Ahmedabad.

Dakota Johnson and Chris Martin (Coldplay) visit Babulnath Mandir to seek blessings before today's concert shows how much he loves India ❤️

title: 'Some abuse must have happened': Aakash Chopra on BCCI enforcing mandatory travel rules for players - The Times of India
summary:
'Some abuse must have happened': Aakash Chopra on BCCI enforcing mandatory travel rules for players

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Aakash Chopra expresses his surprise regarding the BCCI's decision to enforce mandatory travel rules for players, requiring them to travel with the team for matches and practice sessions, suggesting it is a response to prior misuse.

  • Players can no longer travel separately with their families.
  • The rule was introduced post the review meeting following India's loss to Australia in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Chopra questions the necessity of this new regulation, implying that prior abuses led to its enforcement.
  • Players seeking to travel separately must now obtain permission from both the head coach and the chairman of selectors.
“Players cannot travel separately with families. Some abuse must have happened; that's why this rule is being enforced.” - Aakash Chopra

This new directive has raised questions about accountability and whether it is an overreach in response to isolated incidents.
newTitle: 'Some abuse must have happened': Aakash Chopra on BCCI enforcing mandatory travel rules for players

title: WATCH: Canadian man’s doorbell camera captures audio, video of meteorite crashing Earth - The Indian Express
summary:
WATCH: Canadian man’s doorbell camera captures audio, video of meteorite crashing Earth

Date: January 18, 2025 Source: CBC News

An incredible event unfolded as Joe Velaidum recorded both video and audio of a meteorite crashing to Earth, marking what scientists believe to be the first documentation of such an event.

  • A Canadian man's doorbell camera captured the rare event of a meteorite landing.
  • The meteorite is classified as an ordinary chondrite and is the first recorded from Prince Edward Island.
  • Velaidum had been standing at the impact spot just minutes before the meteorite struck.
  • Experts confirmed the authenticity of the meteorite after initial skepticism from Velaidum's family.
  • This documentation provides new insights into the natural history of Prince Edward Island.
“As far as we know, it’s the first time that a meteorite falling to Earth has been recorded on video, with sound.” - Chris Herd, Geologist

The remarkable capture not only showcases a unique scientific milestone but also deepens our understanding of natural events in this region.
newTitle: Canadian Man Captures Meteorite Crash on Doorbell Camera

How to glimpse a parade of planets in the January night sky - Deccan Chronicle
summary:
How to Glimpse a Parade of Planets in the January Night Sky

Publication Date: January 2023

Source: AP News

Six planets grace the sky this month in what’s known as a planetary parade, visible to the naked eye. The planets align on one side of the sun, offering a spectacular view for observers.

  1. Venus, Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn are visible without special equipment.
  2. Uranus and Neptune require binoculars or telescopes to spot.
  3. The best time for viewing is a few hours after sunset on clear nights.
  4. Venus and Saturn will appear especially close, just two degrees apart.
  5. Stargazing apps may enhance the viewing experience.
“It gives us a little bit better sense of our place in the solar system and the universe.” - Kevin Williams, planetarium director

As planets gradually exit through the spring, this astrological event reminds us of our place in the cosmos.
newTitle: How to Glimpse a Parade of Planets in the January Night Sky

33 hostages, 737 prisoners, 42 days: Phase 1 of Israel-Hamas Gaza ceasefire deal | Key details - Hindustan Times
summary:
33 Hostages, 737 Prisoners, 42 Days: Phase 1 of Israel-Hamas Gaza Ceasefire Deal

Date: January 18, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

This article details the ceasefire agreement between Israel and Hamas, marking a significant pause in the ongoing war in Gaza. The deal is set to initiate a 42-day truce beginning January 19, involving the release of hostages and prisoners.

Key Points:

  • The ceasefire will last for 42 days, during which 33 hostages will be released by Hamas.
  • In exchange, Israel will release 737 prisoners and detainees.
  • Hostages will be evaluated by medical professionals upon release.
  • Israeli forces will withdraw from densely populated areas of Gaza during this period.
  • Electronic checkpoints will be set up for returning displaced Palestinians.
  • Phase two negotiations are expected to start halfway through the first phase.

Notable Quotes:

“We hope that this will be the last page of the war and we hope that all parties will commit to implementing all the terms of this agreement,” - Qatari PM Sheikh Mohammed.

This ceasefire represents a critical moment in mitigating tensions and hopes for a long-term resolution to the conflict.
newTitle: 33 Hostages and 737 Prisoners: Overview of Israel-Hamas Ceasefire Deal

title: Barack Obama's Birthday Post For 'Love Of His Life' Wife Michelle Amid Divorce Rumours - News18
summary:
Barack Obama's Heartfelt Birthday Post for Michelle Amid Divorce Rumors

Date: January 18, 2025 | Source: News18

Former US President Barack Obama wished his wife Michelle a happy 61st birthday with a touching post, amid swirling rumors about their marriage.

  • Barack Obama shared a photo of the couple on social media, expressing his love and admiration for Michelle.
  • The post comes as rumors spread about the couple’s divorce, particularly after Michelle Obama's absence from Donald Trump's inauguration.
  • Body language expert Judi James noted signs of strain in their recent public appearances.
  • Michelle Obama responded to Barack's post with a simple, sweet message: “Love you, honey!”

“Happy birthday to the love of my life, Michelle Obama. You fill every room with warmth, wisdom, humor, and grace – and you look good doing it. I’m so lucky to be able to take on life’s adventures with you. Love you!” — Barack Obama

This heartfelt post contrasts with the prevailing conversation about the couple's possible separation, generating mixed sentiments among the public.
newTitle: Barack Obama's Heartfelt Birthday Post for Michelle Amid Divorce Rumors

title: New SUV Brand Enters India! Should Tata & Mahindra Worry? - MotorOctane
summary:
Vinfast Launches New EV SUVs in India – Should Tata & Mahindra Be Concerned?

Publication Date: Today Source: MotorOctane

Today marks the entry of a new Vietnamese automotive brand, Vinfast, in India. The brand has introduced two new electric vehicles (EVs) showcasing their innovations at the Auto Expo.

  • Vinfast launched the VF7 and VF6 electric SUVs at the Auto Expo in India.
  • The VF7 is locally assembled in Tamil Nadu and features a modern design and several high-tech features.
  • Pricing for the VF7 has yet to be announced, while the vehicle is equipped with a 73 kWh battery.
  • The VF6 aims to compete with established models like the Hyundai Creta EV and BYD Atto 3, and includes a 59.6 kWh battery with a range of up to 400 km.
  • Both models feature advanced tech such as ADAS, large infotainment screens, and luxurious interiors.
The new Vinfast SUV gets a 59.6 kWh battery pack and offers a range of up to 400 km on a single charge internationally.

This entry of Vinfast into the Indian market introduces significant competition for existing brands like Tata and Mahindra, especially in the rapidly evolving EV sector.
newTitle: Vinfast Launches New EV SUVs in India – Should Tata & Mahindra Be Concerned?

Emergency Box Office Collection Day 1: Kangana Ranaut's Biggest Opener In 5 Years - NDTV Movies
summary:
Emergency Box Office Collection Day 1: Kangana Ranaut's Biggest Opener In 5 Years

Publication Date: New Delhi

Source: NDTV

The film Emergency marks Kangana Ranaut's first solo directorial project and has achieved her biggest box-office opening since pre-pandemic times, earning Rs 2.35 crore on its opening day.

  • Opening Day Collection: Rs 2.35 crore, highest among her recent releases.
  • Comparison: Previous solo films opened with Rs 1.25 crore (Tejas) and Rs 1.20 crore (Dhaakad).
  • Occupancy Rates: Overall Hindi occupancy was 19.26%; highest in Chennai (25%) and Mumbai (23.75%).
  • Best Engagement: Night shows had an occupancy of 36.25% compared to morning (5.98%) and afternoon shows (13.95%).
  • Theme: The film is set during India's Emergency period (1975-1977).

“Emergency had the highest audience attendance in Chennai, with a 25% occupancy.”

The opening reflects a significant return for Kangana Ranaut as a director and may indicate renewed audience interest in her work.
newTitle: Kangana Ranaut's Emergency Box Office Opens Strong

summary:
Saif Ali Khan stabbed: 48 hours gone, 30 Mumbai Police teams formed. Where is the attacker?

Date: January 18, 2025
Source: HT News Desk

Over 48 hours after Bollywood actor Saif Ali Khan was stabbed by an intruder at his Mumbai residence, police continue their search as Khan recovers at Lilavati Hospital.

  • Actor was attacked during a robbery attempt at his apartment in Bandra.
  • More than 30 police teams are actively working to find the assailant.
  • The attacker’s face was captured on CCTV, prompting a wide investigation.
  • Doctors report Khan is recovering well and may be discharged soon.
  • A carpenter was questioned, but later released; he was not connected to any crime gang.
“We are observing his progress, and he is doing excellently well according to our expectations.” - Dr. Nitin Dange

The incident has raised concerns about safety, but Khan's swift recovery provides a hopeful outlook for both him and his fans.
newTitle: Saif Ali Khan Stabbing: Ongoing Manhunt by 30 Mumbai Police Teams

title: 8th Pay Commission Announced: Is Income Tax Relief Next? Experts Urge Budget 2025 Support for Middle Class - Times Now
summary:
8th Pay Commission Announced: Is Income Tax Relief Next?

Publication Date: New Delhi

The announcement of the 8th Pay Commission has sparked discussions on the possibility of income tax relief for the middle class in the upcoming Budget 2025. This pay commission is expected to benefit over a crore central government employees and pensioners.

  • The government aims to produce consumption demand by enhancing wages through tax relief.
  • Experts believe income tax relief is essential to boost consumption and economic growth.
  • Political analyst Amitabh Tiwari emphasizes the need for immediate relief for individual taxpayers.
  • The 8th Pay Commission is expected to enhance consumption growth similar to measures taken during the 2008 global crisis.
  • The current tax structure is seen as unfavorable to the middle class, despite some increase in tax exemption limits.
“There needs to be immediate relief for individual taxpayers in the Budget to boost consumption and the economy.” - Amitabh Tiwari

In conclusion, the establishment of the 8th Pay Commission alongside potential tax relief for the middle class could foster economic growth by increasing consumption.
newTitle: 8th Pay Commission Announced: Is Income Tax Relief Next?

Delhi fog: 47 trains, several flights delayed; Rain, thunderstorm likely next week, says IMD - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi fog: 47 trains, several flights delayed; Rain, thunderstorm likely next week, says IMD

Date: January 18, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Severe fog conditions in Delhi are causing significant disruptions in travel, with 47 trains delayed and multiple flights unable to take off due to low visibility.

  • Temperature in Delhi is expected to reach a minimum of 7°C and a maximum of 19°C.
  • Foggy conditions are predicted to persist for three days, followed by potential rain or thunderstorms on January 22 and 23.
  • Delhi's air quality improved due to recent rains, leading to the rollback of the Graded Response Action Plan restrictions.
  • Cold wave conditions are affecting various regions of North India, including Uttar Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh.
  • Dense fog is expected in Punjab, Haryana, Chandigarh, and East Rajasthan.
“As per the air quality and weather forecast provided by IMD/IITM, there is a likelihood of AQI to remain in lower end of the Very Poor category in the coming days owing to the favourable meteorological conditions and strong wind speeds,” - CAQM statement.

This weather pattern underscores the need for vigilance as transportation delays may continue and weather conditions evolve throughout the week.
newTitle: Delhi Fog Disrupts Travel; Rain and Thunderstorms Forecast Next Week

Emergency box office collection day 1: Kangana Ranaut scores her biggest opening in 5 years with maiden solo directorial - Hindustan Times
summary:
Emergency Box Office Collection Day 1: Kangana Ranaut Scores Her Biggest Opening in 5 Years

Date: Jan 18, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The film 'Emergency', Kangana Ranaut's first solo directorial, has hit cinemas and opened with impressive figures, marking her biggest box office opening in five years.

  • The film opened at ₹2.35 crore on its first day.
  • This surpasses her previous openings, including 'Tejas' which earned ₹1.25 crore and 'Dhaakad' with ₹1.20 crore.
  • Emergency's storyline centers around the 1975 Emergency in India, with Kangana portraying Indira Gandhi.
  • Despite its opening success, the film faced controversy and protests related to its content, particularly from the SGPC.
Kangana mentioned that the SGPC's demand for a ban on 'Emergency' is a complete harassment of "art and the artist."

The debut of 'Emergency' stands out as a significant moment in Kangana's career, illustrating both the challenges and triumphs of filmmaking in a politically sensitive landscape.
newTitle: Kangana Ranaut's 'Emergency' Achieves Biggest Box Office Opening in Five Years
